greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the product of (1+A328311(x)) applied over all values x obtained when arithmetic derivative (A003415) is iterated starting from x=n, until 1 is encountered, or 0 if no 1 is ever encountered (in which case such product would be infinite).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
program: A003415checked(n) = if(n<=1, 0, my(f=factor(n), s=0); for(i=1, #f~, if(f[i,2]>=f[i,1],return(0), s += f[i, 2]/f[i, 1])); (n*s));
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 13 2019
